qas.question: What type of anthropology is used to analyse and find solutions to real world problems?
What do the instrumental methods of applied anthropology produce?
What type of action does applied anthropology initiate?
What side of anthropology is applied anthropology?
Included in applied anthropology is researcher involvement as well as activism in what communities?
What refers to the study of the methods and theries of anthropology?

plausible_answers.text: change or stability in specific cultural systems

qas.question: What produces methods of applied anthropology?
What is the creative side of anthropology?
what is distincly different than Development Anthropology?

context: <a0_0><b5_0><b8_0>Applied<a0_0/> Anthropology<b8_0/><b5_0/> refers to the application of the method and theory of anthropology to the analysis and solution of practical problems. It is a, "complex of related, research-based, instrumental methods which produce <a1_0><b6_0>change or stability<a1_0/> in specific cultural systems<b6_0/> through the provision of data, initiation of <a2_0>direct<a2_0/> action, and/or the formulation of policy". More simply, <b7_0>applied anthropology<b7_0/> is <a3_0>the practical side<a3_0/> of anthropological research; it includes researcher involvement and activism within the <a4_0>participating<a4_0/> community. It is closely related to Development anthropology (distinct from the more critical Anthropology of development).
